meanings.definition: Shocked or scandalized by deliberately outrageous behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The audience was epatered by the bold fashion choices on the runway.
meanings.sent2: She felt epatered by the unexpected turn of events in the movie.
meanings.sent3: The cat epatered the dog by wearing a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: His eccentric artwork epatered the traditional art community.
meanings.sent5: The loud music and bright lights epatered the quiet town.

meanings.definition: To shock or scandalize by deliberately outrageous behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The artist epatered the critics with his avant-garde exhibition.
meanings.sent2: She epatered her classmates with her unconventional presentation.
meanings.sent3: The prankster epatered his friends by dressing up as a giant banana.
meanings.sent4: His bold statements epatered the political establishment.
meanings.sent5: The magician epatered the audience with his mind-bending tricks.
